text: Sachiko Honda (本田幸子, December 30, 1930 - May 1st, 2020) is a female 8-danShe was promoted to 7-dan from 6-dan in occasion of her player retirement in 2000She was promoted to 8-dan from 7-dan in occasion of her death. Japanese professional Go player at Nihon Ki-in.Sachiko Honda at GoBaseSachiko Honda at GoRatingsSachiko Honda at Sensei's Library ==Notable achievements== Year Notes 1969 and 1972 Received the female MVP (棋道賞女流賞) 1982 and 1984 Obtained the female Honinbo title (女流本因坊) 2004 Received the Kishichiro Ohkura Award (大倉喜七郎賞, Award for individuals strongly promoting Go) ==Related players== The Mukai sisters (Kozue, Chiaki, Kaori) are her pupils, and all of them are professional players. She also has two sisters: Kazuko Sugiuchi (Older sister, mentor of Tomoko Kato) and Teruko Kusunoki (Younger sister), both of them are professional players. ==Related pages== * Go Seigen (Sachiko Honda visited Taiwan with him in 1952. This visit was organized for the promotion of Go) * Masao Sugiuchi (Her brother in law) ==Other websites== * Official profile at Nihon Ki-in ==Notes== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Japanese Go players Category:Sportswomen
title: Sachiko Honda
